skill.name: backend-dev-guidelines
skill.description: Comprehensive backend development guide for Node.js/Express/TypeScript microservices. Use when creating routes, controllers, services, repositories, middleware, or working with Express APIs, Prisma database access, Sentry error tracking, Zod validation, unifiedConfig, dependency injection, or async patterns. Covers layered architecture (routes → controllers → services → repositories), BaseController pattern, error handling, performance monitoring, testing strategies, and migration from legacy patterns.

security_audit.summary: All 555 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. This is a documentation/guide skill containing educational code examples. The detected patterns (shell commands, environment variables, path traversal, crypto algorithms) are in markdown code blocks demonstrating best practices and anti-patterns. The skill actively promotes secure coding - it teaches AGAINST vulnerabilities like path traversal and weak cryptography, not exploits them.

content.value_statement: Create consistent, maintainable backend services with proven Node.js/Express/TypeScript patterns. This skill provides architectural guidance, code templates, and security-aware patterns for microservices development.
actual_capabilities: Generate layered architecture code (routes → controllers → services → repositories)
Create BaseController classes with error handling patterns
Implement Zod validation schemas for input validation
Set up Prisma database access patterns with repository layer
Configure Sentry error tracking and performance monitoring
Apply dependency injection and async error handling patterns
limitations: Does not generate database migrations or schema changes
Does not deploy services or configure infrastructure
Focused on Node.js/Express/TypeScript - not other backends
Assumes existing unifiedConfig and PrismaService setup

use_cases.title: New Feature Implementation
use_cases.description: Generate controller, service, and repository code following architectural patterns for new API endpoints.

use_cases.title: Codebase Standardization
use_cases.description: Establish consistent patterns across multiple microservices with BaseController and unifiedConfig usage.

use_cases.title: Express API Development
use_cases.description: Build Express routes with proper middleware, validation, and error tracking integration.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new /users/:id endpoint with UserController that extends BaseController, includes Zod validation, and proper error handling with Sentry.

prompt_templates.title: Service Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a UserService with dependency injection pattern, including repository calls and async error handling wrapper.

prompt_templates.title: Repository Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a UserRepository pattern with PrismaService usage, transaction support, and query optimization examples.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate complete feature with routes, BaseController, service with DI, repository layer, Zod validation schemas, and Jest tests.

output_examples.input: Create a POST /posts endpoint with authentication
output: Complete route definition with SSO middleware
Zod validation schema for post data

output_examples.input: Convert legacy callback code to async/await
Add input validation to existing endpoint
output: Zod schema definition with type inference
Validation in controller before service call

best_practices: Use layered architecture: routes delegate to controllers, controllers call services, services use repositories.
Always extend BaseController for consistent error handling, breadcrumbs, and Sentry integration.
Validate all input with Zod schemas before business logic - reject invalid data early.
anti_patterns: Never put business logic in route handlers - delegate to controllers.
Never use process.env directly - use unifiedConfig for type safety and testing.
Never skip error handling - all async operations need try/catch with Sentry capture.

faq.question: What architecture pattern does this skill use?
faq.answer: Layered architecture with routes → controllers → services → repositories separation of concerns.

faq.question: Can this skill generate tests?
faq.answer: Yes, includes Jest unit and integration test patterns with mocking strategies.

faq.question: Does this skill work with other frameworks?
faq.answer: Focused on Express/Node.js/TypeScript - patterns adapt to similar frameworks.

faq.question: How does this skill handle errors?
faq.answer: BaseController provides handleError, handleSuccess, withTransaction, and Sentry integration.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing codebases?
faq.answer: Yes, provides refactoring guides from legacy patterns to modern architecture.

faq.question: What validation library is used?
faq.answer: Zod for runtime TypeScript validation with type inference from schemas.
